result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Atty Cassidy asks that 22CT50 be scheduled at the same time.

3:03 PM Defendant Hannah Grace Ilene Petty appeared by video from the Waupaca County jail, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Hannah Grace Ilene Petty. 

Atty Bergner did not have a chance to go over a preliminary hearing waiver with her but did speak to her about what it would entail. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Cooperate with Department of Health and Human Services with regards to the children, S.R. and L.R. - nothing that is said by the defendant with regards to the children should not be used against her from this date forward

2:32 PM Defendant Hannah Grace Ilene Petty appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of Maxwell Bergner for Hannah Grace Ilene Petty. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Preliminary Hearing to be held within time limits.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
